column1: He found himself sitting at his computer
column2: typing whatever came to mind. He was on a website entitled 10 fast fingers. This site tested how fast you were at typing. So he typed. He was currently typing about himself typing
column3: which is odd in a way. He was now describing about how he was typing about himself typing.

column1: Carrot is a vegetable that is grown on the ground. They are mostly orange in colour but can be yellow
column4: and white. It contains many nutrients like protein

column1: The European Union (EU) is a political and economic union of 27 member states that are located primarily in Europe. The union has an estimated total population of about 447 million
column2: containing some 5.8% of the world's population in 2020.

column1: Canada is made up of ten provinces and three territories. The provinces are between the 45th and 60th parallels of latitude
column2: and the territories are to the north of the 60th parallel of latitude. Most large cities in Canada are in the southern part of the country

column1: The Vikings were a Scandinavian people from Northern Europe who were known as great seamen and warriors. From the 8th to the 11th centuries they traveled to Europe in their long ships
column2: attacking and then settling in areas that are now modern Great Britain

column1: History is the study of past events. People know what happened in the past by looking at things from the past including sources (like books
column6: coins and human or animal remains).
